content.text: 1 （a）Write the number 70000000 in words．
（b）（i）Write down the value of the 5 in the number 0.25 ． Give your answer as a fraction．
（ii）Find the value of the reciprocal of 0.25 ．
2 （a）Write down the mathematical name for an angle between \(90^{\circ}\) and \(180^{\circ}\) ．
（b）Write down the mathematical term that describes two polygons that are the same shape and size．
3 (a) Write down \(\sqrt{169}\).
(b) Work out the value of \(2^{4}\).
(c) Work out the value of \(10^{-2}\).
(d) Work out \(-18 \div-4\).
(e) Work out \(1.6 \times 0.02\).
4 The diagram shows a quadrilateral with sides of equal length.
SCALE
(a) Write down the mathematical name for this quadrilateral.
(b) Work out the value of \(a\).
5 Find the next term in each sequence.
(a) \(1, \quad 5, \quad 10, \quad 16, \quad 23, \quad \cdots\)
(b) \(1, \quad 2, \quad 4, \quad 8, \quad 16, \quad \cdots\)
6 These are the lengths of time, in minutes, of seven phone calls.
(a) (i) Find the median.
(ii) Find the range.
min [1]
(b) The longest phone call is 75 minutes.
Write 75 minutes in hours.
770 students study one of French, Spanish and German.
The ratio number who study French : number who study Spanish \(=3: 7\). 15 students study French.
Find the number of students who study German.
8 The diagram shows two faces of a net of a cuboid on a \(1 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\) grid.
(a) Complete the statement.
The dimensions of the cuboid are cm by cm by cm.
(b) On the grid, complete a net of the cuboid.
(c) Work out the volume of the cuboid.
9 The diagram shows the net of a square-based pyramid.
NOT TO SCALE
The perpendicular height of each triangle is 4 cm . The base has side length 5 cm .
(a) Calculate the surface area of the pyramid.
\(\mathrm{cm}^{2}\)
(b) Write down the number of edges of the square-based pyramid.
10 (a) Line \(A\) has equation \(y=3 x+1\). Line \(B\) has equation \(\quad y=3 x-1\).
Draw a ring around the description that is correct.
Line \(A\) intersects Line \(A\) has a Line \(A\) is line \(B\) steeper gradient perpendicular to
than line \(B\) line \(B\)
Line \(A\) is parallel Line \(A\) and Line \(B\) to line \(B\) intersect the \(y\)-axis
at the same point
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y=2 x-1\).
11 Jo asks 90 people whether they prefer pop, rock, classical, jazz or folk music. The pie chart shows some of the results.
(a) Work out the number of people who prefer pop.
(b) The sector angle for classical is \(80^{\circ}\).
Draw this sector on the pie chart.
(c) 9 people prefer jazz and the rest prefer folk.
(i) Work out the size of the sector angle for jazz.
(ii) Complete the pie chart.
12 A music group has 30 members.
7 members play a flute \((F)\) and play a clarinet \((C)\). 12 members play a flute.
1 member does not play a flute and does not play a clarinet.
(a) Use this information to complete the Venn diagram.
(b) Find \(\mathrm{n}(C)\).
13 By writing each number in the calculation correct to 1 significant figure, find an estimate for the value of
NOT TO SCALE
The diagram shows a trapezium. The area of the trapezium is \(42 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\).
Work out the value of \(h\).
15 (a) Write down the inequality represented on the number line.
(b) Write down the smallest integer that satisfies the inequality \(d>-3 \frac{1}{4}\).
16 On Monday the cost of a concert ticket is \(\$ x\) ． On Tuesday the cost of a ticket for the same concert is \(20 \%\) more than the cost on Monday．
Jack buys 4 tickets on Monday and 5 tickets on Tuesday． Jack pays \(\$ 270\) in total．
Work out the value of \(x\) ．
17 Simplify．
NOT TO SCALE
The diagram shows a circle, centre \(O\). \(P\) and \(S\) are points on the circle.
\(P O R\) is a straight line. \(Q R S T\) is a tangent to the circle at \(S\).
(a) Find the value of \(x\). Give a geometrical reason for your answer.
\(x=\) because
(b) Find the value of \(y\).
NOT TO SCALE
The diagram shows a sector of a circle with radius 3 cm and sector angle \(60^{\circ}\).
Calculate the area of the sector. Give your answer in terms of \(\pi\) in its simplest form.
20 Find the highest common factor (HCF) of 36 and 54.
21 In this question, all lengths are in centimetres.
The perimeter of the triangle is equal to the perimeter of the rectangle.
Form an equation and solve it to find the value of \(x\).
Rearrange the formula to make \(h\) the subject.

\(x \mathrm{~cm}\)
2 cm

Rectangle \(A\)

content.text: Rectangle \(A\) is mathematically similar to rectangle \(B\).
Work out the value of \(x\).
Give your answer as a mixed number in its simplest form.
25 Solve the simultaneous equations.
